description: From Latin sōpītus, perfect passive participle of sopiō (“I put to sleep”) + -tion.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The act of putting to sleep.
examples: But as for dementation, sopition of reason, and the diviner particle from drink, though American religion approve, and Pagan piety of old hath practised, even at their sacrifices; Christian morality and the doctrine of Christ will not allow.
